io.github.struppigel.parser

Class IOUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.struppigel.parser.IOUtil

  • public final class IOUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    Utilities for file IO needed to read maps and arrays from the text files in the data subdirectory of PortEx.

    The default specification text files are CSV, where the values are separated by semicolon and a new entry begins on a new line.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  IOUtil.SpecificationFormat
      Describes the format/indices of the specification file.

    • Method Detail

      • dumpLocationToFile

        public static void dumpLocationToFile(PhysicalLocation loc,
                                      java.io.File inFile,
                                      java.io.File outFile)
                               throws java.io.IOException
        Dumps the given part of the inFile to outFile. The part to dump is represented by loc. This will read safely from inFile which means locations outside of inFile are written as zero bytes to outFile. outFile must not exist yet. inFile must exist and must not be a directory.
        Parameters:
        loc -
        inFile -
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • loadBytesSafely

        public static byte[] loadBytesSafely(long offset,
                                     int length,
                                     java.io.RandomAccessFile raf)
                              throws java.io.IOException
        Loads the bytes at the offset into a byte array with the given length using the raf. If EOF, the byte array is zero padded. If offset < 0 it will return a zero sized array.
        Parameters:
        offset - to seek
        length - of the byte array, equals number of bytes read
        raf - the random access file
        Returns:
        byte array
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if unable to read the bytes

      • readHeaderEntriesForSpec

        public static <T extends java.lang.Enum<T> & HeaderKey> java.util.Map<T,StandardField> readHeaderEntriesForSpec(java.lang.Class<T> clazz,
                                                                                                                IOUtil.SpecificationFormat specFormat,
                                                                                                                java.util.List<java.lang.String[]> specification,
                                                                                                                byte[] headerbytes,
                                                                                                                long headerOffset)
        Reads the entries of a Header and returns a map containing the HeaderKey as key and StandardField as value.

        The map is initialized with all possible HeaderKeys of the subtype and empty fields.

        The passed instances must not be null and the specName must not be empty.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type for the header key that the returned map shall use
        Parameters:
        clazz - the concrete subclass of the HeaderKey
        specFormat - the format of the specification file
        specification - the specification to be used for reading the fields
        headerbytes - the bytes of the header
        headerOffset - the file offset to the start of the headerbytes
        Returns:
        header entries

      • readHeaderEntries

        public static <T extends java.lang.Enum<T> & HeaderKey> java.util.Map<T,StandardField> readHeaderEntries(java.lang.Class<T> clazz,
                                                                                                         IOUtil.SpecificationFormat specFormat,
                                                                                                         java.lang.String specName,
                                                                                                         byte[] headerbytes,
                                                                                                         long headerOffset)
                                                                                                  throws java.io.IOException
        Reads the entries of a Header and returns a map containing the HeaderKey as key and StandardField as value.

        The map is initialized with all possible HeaderKeys of the subtype and empty fields.

        The passed instances must not be null and the specName must not be empty.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type for the header key that the returned map shall use
        Parameters:
        clazz - the concrete subclass of the HeaderKey
        specFormat - the format of the specification file
        specName - the name of the specification file (not the path to it), must not be empty.
        headerbytes - the bytes of the header
        headerOffset - the file offset to the start of the headerbytes
        Returns:
        header entries
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if specification file can not be read

      • initFullEnumMap

        public static <T extends java.lang.Enum<T> & HeaderKey> java.util.Map<T,StandardField> initFullEnumMap(java.lang.Class<T> clazz)
        Initialized a map containing all keys of the Enum T as map-key and default StandardFields as map-value.

        Ensures that no null value is returned.

        Returns:
        the fully initialized map

      • readMap

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String[]> readMap(java.lang.String filename)
                                                                  throws java.io.IOException
        Reads the specified file into a map. The first value is used as key. The rest is put into a list and used as map value. Each entry is one line of the file.

        Ensures that no null value is returned.

        Uses the default DEFAULT_DELIMITER

        Parameters:
        filename - the name of the specification file (not the path to it)
        Returns:
        a map with the first column as keys and the other columns as values.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if unable to read the specification file

      • readMap

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String[]> readMap(java.lang.String filename,
                                                                         java.lang.String delimiter)
                                                                  throws java.io.IOException
        Reads the specified file into a map. The first value is used as key. The rest is put into a list and used as map value. Each entry is one line of the file.

        Ensures that no null value is returned.

        Parameters:
        filename - the name of the specification file (not the path to it)
        delimiter - the delimiter regex for one column
        Returns:
        a map with the first column as keys and the other columns as values.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if unable to read the specification file

      • readSymbolDescriptions

        public static java.util.List<SymbolDescription> readSymbolDescriptions()
                                                                throws java.io.IOException
        Reads a list of symbol descriptions
        Returns:
        list of SymbolDescriptions
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • readArray

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String[]> readArray(java.lang.String filename)
                                                    throws java.io.IOException
        Reads the specified file from the specification directory into a list of arrays. Each array is the entry of one line in the file.

        Ensures that no null value is returned.

        Uses the default DEFAULT_DELIMITER

        Parameters:
        filename - the name of the specification file (not the path to it)
        Returns:
        a list of arrays, each array representing a line in the spec
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if unable to read the specification file

      • readArray

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String[]> readArray(java.lang.String filename,
                                                           java.lang.String delimiter)
                                                    throws java.io.IOException
        Reads the specified file from the specification directory into a list of arrays. Each array is the entry of one line in the file.

        Ensures that no null value is returned.

        Parameters:
        filename - the name of the specification file (not the path to it)
        delimiter - the delimiter regex for one column
        Returns:
        a list of arrays, each array representing a line in the spec
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if unable to read the specification file

      • readArrayFrom

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String[]> readArrayFrom(java.io.File file)
                                                        throws java.io.IOException
        Reads the specified file into a list of arrays. Each array is the entry of one line in the file.

        This method allows to read from files outside of the packaged jar.

        Ensures that no null value is returned.

        Uses the default DEFAULT_DELIMITER

        Parameters:
        file - the file to read from, UTF-8 encoded
        Returns:
        a list of arrays, each array representing a line in the spec
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if unable to read the file

        Parameters:

        Returns:
